alert.note: Alert for Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 7:51AM EST until March 01 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING ACCUMULATING SNOW TO THE REGION THROUGH THIS EVENING... .An area of low pressure approaches this morning before pulling away from the region tonight. Snow has overspread the southwestern areas and will expand northeastward through this morning before tapering off tonight. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 7 inches for a storm total of 2 to 8 inches. Downsloping north of the White Mountains will result in lower amounts. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 5 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
